datastructures.trees

Interface MaxHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Comparable type of Object that will be held by the MaxHeap.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayMaxHeap, LinkedMaxHeap

    public interface MaxHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>
    MaxHeaps are complete binary search trees whose node contents are always larger than the contents of their children nodes. MaxHeaps inherit neither the Tree interface nor the BinarySearchTree interface. This is because they are much simpler data structures and it doesn't make sense for us to provide definitions for operations such as particular tree traversals, or retrieving the minimum element from the tree. We thus make heaps "atomic" tree structures in the inheritance sense.
    Author:
    Jason Filippou (jasonfil@cs.umd.edu)

      Add an element in the MaxHeap.

      Returns the maximum element of the MaxHeap.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Queries the MaxHeap for emptiness.
      java.util.Iterator<T> iterator()
      MaxHeaps will provide for an Iterator which will provide the intuitive max-min traversal.
      T removeMax()
      Removes and returns the maximum element from the MaxHeap.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in the MaxHeap.
